graph_title: Percentage of drug and alcohol users who have completed treatment
indicator_available: Percentage of drug and alcohol users who have completed treatment
indicator_name: Coverage of treatment interventions (pharmacological, psychosocial and rehabilitation and aftercare services) for substance use disorders
SDG_GOAL__GLOBAL: Goal 3: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
SDG_TARGET__GLOBAL: Target 3.5: Strengthen the prevention and treatment of substance abuse, including narcotic drug abuse and harmful use of alcohol
SDG_INDICATOR__GLOBAL: Indicator 3.5.1: Coverage of treatment interventions (pharmacological, psychosocial and rehabilitation and aftercare services) for substance use disorders
SDG_CUSTODIAN_AGENCIES__GLOBAL: World Health Organisation (WHO), United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC)
SDG_GOAL: Goal 3: Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages
SDG_TARGET: Target 3.5: Strengthen the prevention and treatment of substance abuse, including narcotic drug abuse and harmful use of alcohol
SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 3.5.1: Coverage of treatment interventions (pharmacological, psychosocial and rehabilitation and aftercare services) for substance use disorders
SOURCE_TYPE: Successful completion of drug treatment - opiate users, Successful completion of drug treatment - non-opiate users, Successful completion of alcohol treatment
REC_USE_LIM: The data shows the percentage of users who complete treatment successfully and do not re-present to treatment in 6 months. Achieving this outcome demonstrates improvements in well-being and health, resulting in increased longevity and fewer hospital admissions related to drug and alcohol use.
